channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A federal jury finds Milwaukee judge guilty of obstructing immigration agents
item.description: A jury returns a guilty/not guilty verdict in the case of Hannah Dugan. The Milwaukee judge was accused of allowing an undocumented immigrant defender to evade immigration agents
item.content:encoded:
A jury returns a guilty/not guilty verdict in the case of Hannah Dugan.  The Milwaukee judge was accused of allowing an undocumented immigrant defender to evade immigration agents

(Image credit: Adela Tesnow)
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: As the holidays near, colleges work to ensure students have enough to eat
item.description: With grocery costs on the rise, it's been a challenging time for college students facing food insecurity. Many are stocking up at food pantries before the end of the semester.
item.content:encoded: With grocery costs on the rise, it's been a challenging time for college students facing food insecurity. Many are stocking up at food pantries before the end of the semester.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: Mangione pre-trial hearing wraps, but judge won't rule on evidence for months
item.description: After three weeks of testimony, a judge will now rule on whether evidence found in Mangione's backpack can be used in his state trial for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.
item.content:encoded:
After three weeks of testimony, a judge will now rule on whether evidence found in Mangione's backpack can be used in his state trial for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

(Image credit: Luiz C. Ribeiro)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: What to know about Jared Isaacman, the billionaire private astronaut leading NASA
item.description: Trump withdrew Isaacman's nomination in May, citing the billionaire's donations to Democrats and ties to Elon Musk. He was renominated last month and confirmed by a 67-30 Senate vote on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Trump withdrew Isaacman's nomination in May, citing the billionaire's donations to Democrats and ties to Elon Musk. He was renominated last month and confirmed by a 67-30 Senate vote on Wednesday.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
item.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.
item.content:encoded:
Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

(Image credit: Sarah Ventre)
item.dc:creator: Claire Giangrave

item.title: Takeaways from Trump's address. And, some GOP lawmakers shift stance on ACA subsidies
item.description: During a nationwide address, President Trump says the U.S. is poised for an economic boom. And, some Republican lawmakers joined Democrats to force a vote on enhanced healthcare subsidies.
item.content:encoded:
During a nationwide address, President Trump says the U.S. is poised for an economic boom. And, some Republican lawmakers joined Democrats to force a vote on enhanced healthcare subsidies.

(Image credit: Doug Mills)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Where we went: NPR's U.S. travel guide for the curious
item.description: NPR's staff traveled a lot in 2025. From a Mardi Gras workshop to a festival celebrating the mythical Mothman, here are some places and events we thought you might want to check out, too.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's staff traveled a lot in 2025. From a Mardi Gras workshop to a festival celebrating the mythical Mothman, here are some places and events we thought you might want to check out, too.

(Image credit: Images by NPR)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Under Trump, 317,000 workers are out of the government. Here are 3 of their stories
item.description: Mass firings, buyouts and heightened uncertainty led to an exodus of federal workers in 2025. More than 300,000 employees will be out of the government by the end of December.
item.content:encoded:
Mass firings, buyouts and heightened uncertainty led to an exodus of federal workers in 2025. More than 300,000 employees will be out of the government by the end of December.

(Image credit: Maansi Srivastava and Tristan Spinski for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump defends his economic record in primetime address, GOP congressmen join Democrats to force ACA subsidy extension vote, Trump orders ban on sanctioned oil tankers traveling to and from Venezuela
item.content:encoded: Trump defends his economic record in primetime address, GOP congressmen join Democrats to force ACA subsidy extension vote, Trump orders ban on sanctioned oil tankers traveling to and from Venezuela
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Catastrophic flooding forces hundreds of Washington families from their homes
item.description: Hundreds of families across Washington state have been displaced by severe flooding, with some seeking safety in emergency shelters. Recovery may take years as rain continues to fall in the region.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of families across Washington state have been displaced by severe flooding, with some seeking safety in emergency shelters. Recovery may take years as rain continues to fall in the region.
item.dc:creator: Casey Martin
